intro: Galium chaetophorum var. strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
